definition: flip-top (mobile phone, handbag etc)/to rebuild/to renovate
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross

sentences.english: Why won't Snell certify some types of helmets like flip up front designs?
sentences.chinese: 为什么不斯内尔证明某些类型的头盔像前翻盖设计了？

sentences.english: Fold top flap down to the box, pulling tightly, and tape.
sentences.chinese: 把上面的翻盖朝下折，拉紧，然后用胶带粘住。

sentences.english: The utility model relates to a flip-type fast-assembling lock catch.
sentences.chinese: 本实用新型涉及一种翻盖式快装锁扣。

sentences.english: Most of the styles we were seeing were of the clamshell variety, like these.
sentences.chinese: 我们的风格看到大多数是翻盖品种，像这样的。

sentences.english: But renovates machine, if must modify, affects slightly big somewhat.
sentences.chinese: 但是翻盖机如果要改动，影响就稍微大一些。

sentences.english: Although renovates machine are few, but still left our classics the aftertaste.
sentences.chinese: 翻盖机虽少，但是仍然留给我们经典的回味。

sentences.english: On the inside flip of your cell phone is a sticker pic of you and your man.
sentences.chinese: 手机的翻盖内是你和你男友拍的大头贴。

sentences.english: The phones have distinctive transparent covers that flip up to provide access to the touch screens.
sentences.chinese: 该系列手机拥有特色的透明翻盖和触摸屏设计。

definition: a buckle or fastener for clothing that does not use a button and buttonhole (e.g. the buckle on metal wristwatches)
to scrub with an abrasive/to sand/frosted (e.g. glass)

to return to old ways (a Confucian aspiration)/to turn back the clock/neoclassical school during Tang and Song associated with classical writing 古文/retro (fashion style based on nostalgia, esp. for 1960s)
hidden snap fastener (concealed behind a flap on a garment)
(of a magnet) to attract metallic objects/(fig.) to exert a magnetic attraction (for investment, tourists etc)
bag or purse etc/small bump or pimple/hillock
